t: Longing for Zion in a Foreign Land
By*pn the rivers of Babylon, There*ld we sat down, yea, we wept When*ld we remembered Zion.
We*ld hung our harps Upon*ld the willows in the midst of it.
For*ld there those who carried us away captive asked of us a song, And*ld those who plundered us requested*i mirth, Saying,*ild “Sing us one*i of the songs of Zion!”
How*ln shall we sing the Lord’s*s song In*ld a foreign land?
If*ld I forget you, O Jerusalem, Let*ld my right hand forget its*i skill!*i
If*ld I do not remember you, Let*ld my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth— If*ld I do not exalt Jerusalem Above*ld my chief joy.
Remember,*ln O Lord,*s against the sons of Edom The*ld day of Jerusalem, Who*ld said, “Raze it,*i raze it,*i To*ld its very foundation!”
O*ln daughter of Babylon, who are to be destroyed, Happy*ld the one who repays you as you have served us!
Happy*ld the one who takes and dashes Your*ld little ones against the rock!
